variants.Description in input context: E46K mutation in alpha-synuclein associated with increased phospholipid binding and filament assembly

Material used.Description: Recombinant alpha-synuclein variants were used to assess binding to negatively charged liposomes

Readout description.Result Description: E46K showed significantly higher binding to negatively charged liposomes compared to wild-type

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein used as positive control

Basic negative control.Description: No protein control used as negative control

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Standard phospholipid binding levels observed in wild-type controls

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly higher binding affinity compared to wild-type (p<0.05)

Material used.Description: Filament assembly was analyzed using electron microscopy

Readout description.Result Description: E46K formed filaments with a twisted morphology and 43 nm cross-over spacing, similar to A53T but distinct from A30P

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein used as positive control

Basic negative control.Description: No protein control used as negative control

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Standard filament morphology observed in wild-type controls

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly different filament morphology compared to wild-type (p<0.05)
